summary: PGY3-HUB D3.js Implementation Testing - CRITICAL FAILURE: D3.js switch incomplete, Cytoscape references causing runtime errors and complete application breakdown.

ui_bugs.issue: ReferenceError: getCytoscape is not defined - Cytoscape functions still referenced in D3.js implementation
ui_bugs.error_details: getCytoscape is not defined at DashboardComponent. The switch from Cytoscape to D3.js is incomplete - old Cytoscape function calls remain in the code.
ui_bugs.impact: Complete application failure - red error overlay prevents any functionality

integration_issues.issue: Incomplete migration - Cytoscape function calls remain in D3.js implementation

passed_tests: ✅ 'Create New Map' button found and clickable
✅ Navigation to mind mapping interface works
✅ Error boundary catches the runtime error (prevents complete crash)
action_item_for_main_agent: CRITICAL: The D3.js migration is incomplete. The code still contains Cytoscape function calls (getCytoscape) that are causing runtime errors. Need to: 1) Remove ALL Cytoscape references from the codebase, 2) Ensure D3Graph component is properly integrated without Cytoscape dependencies, 3) Fix the DashboardComponent crash, 4) Verify D3.js simulation and nodes are properly initialized. The application is currently completely non-functional due to these runtime errors.

success_percentage.frontend: 5% - Critical runtime errors prevent all D3.js functionality
success_percentage.overall: 5% - Application completely broken due to incomplete migration
